sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些前置词均有"横过，穿过"之意。
means: across ：指"从……的一边到另一边"，强调横过，多与动态动词连用。
along ：指沿着一条直线在水平方向上运动。一般表动态，有时也与静态动词连用。
over ：常和动态动词连用，指"从……上面越过"或"横越"；表静态时，指"在彼处"。
through ：侧重从一端穿到另一端。

list.explanation: 凑合过U 了，勉强度曰

example.en: We can get along without your help.
example.zh: 没而你的帮助，我们也能对付过去。

example.en: He didn't get along with the boss.

list.explanation: (常用于进行时态)(人)年纪渐老，上年纪，(时间)渐晚

example.en: My father is getting along (in years) and doesn't see too well any more.
example.zh: 我父亲上了年纪，眼神不如以前了。

jx.jx_en_mean: (N. Amer. informal or dialect)round about (a specified time or date)
jx.jx_cn_mean: (北美，非正式 或 方)大约（某特定时间或日期），…左右

lj.lj_ly: we could head out along about six.
lj.lj_ls: 我们可能六点左右出发。

jx.jx_en_mean: in company with or at the same time as

lj.lj_ls: 我和其他12位艺术家一起被选中。

entry.def: If you move or look along something such as a road, you move or look towards one end of it.

example.ex: Newman walked along the street alone...
The young man led Mark Ryle along a corridor...
example.tran: 那个年轻人领着马克·赖尔沿走廊而去。

entry.def: If something is situated along a road, river, or corridor, it is situated in it or beside it.

example.ex: ...enormous traffic jams all along the roads.
example.tran: 马路上严重的交通阻塞

example.ex: ...houses built on piles along the river...

entry.def: When someone or something moves along, they keep moving in a particular direction.

example.tran: 她蹦蹦跳跳地往前走着。

example.ex: He raised his voice a little, talking into the wind as they walked along...
example.tran: 他们往前走时，他略微提高了嗓音，迎着风说话。

entry.def: If you say that something is going along in a particular way, you mean that it is progressing in that way.

example.ex: ...the negotiations which have been dragging along interminably...
example.tran: 一直在无休止拖延的谈判

example.ex: Everything was coming along fine after all...
example.tran: 一切居然进行得很顺利。

entry.def: If you take someone or something along when you go somewhere, you take them with you.

example.ex: This is open to women of all ages, so bring along your friends and colleagues...
example.tran: 这对所有年龄段的女性开放，所以请带上你的朋友和同事一起光临。

example.ex: Wives will have to bring along their marriage certificate.
example.tran: 已婚妇女必须携带结婚证。

entry.def: If someone or something is coming along or is sent along, they are coming or being sent to a particular place.

example.ex: She invited everyone she knew to come along...
example.tran: 她邀请了每一个她认识的人前来。

example.ex: He had the material tested and sent along the results.
example.tran: 他对材料做了检验并送出了检验结果。

entry.def: You use along with to mention someone or something else that is also involved in an action or situation.

example.ex: The baby's mother escaped from the fire along with two other children...
example.tran: 婴儿的母亲和另外两个孩子一起逃离了火海。

example.ex: There are 32 different kinds of chocolate on sale along with the bread and cakes.
example.tran: 有32种不同的巧克力与面包和蛋糕一起出售。

entry.def: If something has been true or been present all along, it has been true or been present throughout a period of time.

example.ex: I've been fooling myself all along...
I think she had been planning all along to leave Hungary.
example.tran: 我想她一直在计划离开匈牙利。

sentences.sentence: "the horse trotted along at a steady pace"
"the circus traveled on to the next city"

means.word_mean: 2. in accompaniment or as a companion;

sentences.sentence: "his little sister came along to the movies"
"we sent them food and some clothing went along in the package"
"along with the package came a bill"
"consider the advantages along with the disadvantages"

means.word_mean: 5. in line with a length or direction (often followed by `by' or `beside');

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  andlang, of West Germanic origin; related to long
